term_definitions.items: Additional composition metadata aligned with IHE-XDS which is not already available from the Reference Model COMPOSITION class.
The speciality of the author/composer of the document.
A high-level document class code, normally selected from a valueset provided by the IHE-XDS Affinity Domain.
For example: Report, Summary, Images, Plan, Patient Preferences, Workflow. These codes are specific to an XDS Affinity Domain.
The code specifying the precise type of document from the user perspective. Normally selected from a valueset provided by the local IHE-XDS Affinity Domain or national standard.
for example: Pulmonary History and Physical, Discharge Summary, Ultrasound Report. These codes are specific to an XDS Affinity Domain.
A term specifying the level of confidentiality of the XDS Document.
Coded text is preferred, normally specific to an XDS Affinity Domain.
A term defining the healthcare facility type.
Coded text is preferred. The codes are specific to an XDS Affinity Domain.
The code specifying the clinical specialty where the act that resulted in the document was performed.
For example: Family Practice, Laboratory, Radiology. Coded text is preferred, normally specific to an XDS Affinity Domain.
Additional metadata about the document itself, including size, url.
This list of codes represents the main clinical acts.

Provides extra information about the encounter context, regarding the internal cases used at Pathfinder for encounter types and reasons, along with an appointment and encounter id. Terminology should be loaded from the Think!EHR terminology adapter.
Unique identifier for each appointment process.
Unique identifier for each encounter process.
Type of encounter, should be provided by terminology server.
Reason for encounter, should be provided by terminology server.
Score of 15 or Higher: Sleep Study Appointment Recommended
Lying down to rest in the afternoon when circumstances permit?
Have you been asked to lose weight urgently so that you can have an operation or other treatment?
What is the reason for surgey?
When you were at school were you one of the heaviest in your class?
Do you have high blood pressure?
Are you interested in being referred for bariatric surgery?
How many tablets do you take?
How many different kinds of tablets do you take for blood pressure?
Do you experience hunger which doesn't go away with eating?
Have you used laxatives, vomiting, or excessive exercise to lower weight?
Have you ever felt out of control with your eating?
Are there times when youd like to stop eating but cant?
Interaction, contact or care event between a subject of care and healthcare provider(s).
Additional information required to capture local context or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
e.g. Local hospital departmental infomation or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.
